resources:
Future Of ATC Your knowledge Enter the name of the busiest airport in UK TEST YOUR ABILITY\nTO BECOME AN AIR TRAFFIC CONTROLLER This test is not professional test which can surely qualify you as an ATC but only for your personal information. Physiology Psychology Wisdom Checking if you are safe and ‘fit to control’. The tests undertaken as a part of the Aviation Medical Examination are at a high level. Main Factors: Spatial awareness. Multitasking. Memory. Respect for authority. Resilience. Personal authority. Visual-motor coordination. Teamwork. Emotional stability. You must have at least five GCSEs or equivalent at Grade C or above, including English and Maths.
How often do you exercise? 1x/ week 2x/ week 3+ x/ week
Do you take any drugs? (Alcohol, Nicotine, Stronger drugs) Yes No
Which of the following have you been studying? Math Physics History Chemistry
How do you cope with stress? Bad Good Excellent
Have you thought about suicide? Never
How many hours can you perform excellently? Two and less 3 and more
How many languages do you speak fluently? One Two and more
What is your IQ? < 100 < 111 > 115
LET\'S FIND OUT! DO NOT TRY TO BE AN AIR TRAFFIC CONTROLLER! SCORE:0/8 YOU NEED TO SCORE MORE FOR BECOME AN ATC! SCORE: There is a slight chance for you to become an ACT! SCORE: You have some abilities for becoming an ATC, but there are plenty more to be tested by designated authorities. SCORE: You entered wrong name of the airport :/ . /9.
